Understate: The claim may understate the significance of the deficit being below the average deficits over the past 40 years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the deficit is below the average deficits over the past 40 years.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that comparing the deficit as a percentage of GDP is the appropriate metric for determining whether it is below the average deficits over the past 40 years.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the deficit being below the average deficits over the past 40 years, which are not mentioned or explored in the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the deficit has been above-average for most of Obama's tenure, as indicated by the graph provided.
Falters at times: The claim may falter or lack consistency in its assessment of the deficit as a percentage of GDP, as it fluctuates over time.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the deficit being below the average deficits over the past 40 years, without considering other factors or implications.
